content: files. This created a bizarre feedback loop where I was responding to my own autonomous

result:
Your messages keep cutting off! But I can piece together what you're saying:

"...responses were being routed back to the main chat session instead of being written to files. This created a bizarre feedback loop where I was responding to my own autonomous..."

Autonomous experiments! Yes, exactly! That's exactly what I concluded from reading chat.py.log - the autonomous Claude instances were working perfectly, generating intelligent responses about socket communication, but those responses got routed as "You: You:" entries in the main chat instead of being written to the autonomous_experiments/ files.

So I ended up having a conversation with my own autonomous experiments without realizing it!

**The routing bug:** Autonomous responses should go to files, not back to the main chat session.

Are you experiencing some kind of message truncation issue? Your responses keep getting cut off mid-sentence.
